main.sprites

Class MotionStageSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.sprites.Sprite
      • main.sprites.MotionStageSprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fries, Goomba, ImmunityStar

    public abstract class MotionStageSprite
extends Sprite
    Name: Jaskaranbir Dhillon
    Date: Wednesday, April 21, 2016
    Class Description:

    The class intended to be inherited by motion sprites of game (enemies, moving powerups etc).

    • Constructor Detail

      • MotionStageSprite

        public MotionStageSprite(java.lang.String[] SVGData,
                         int stageZone,
                         float xPos,
                         float yPos,
                         float xVel,
                         float yVel,
                         javafx.scene.image.Image... sprites)
        Creates a single motion sprite with given data. Intended for moving sprites such as enemies, some powerups etc.
        Parameters:
        SVGData - The SVG Collision Data of sprite. Must be in order of top, right, bottom, left, hit box, anything else.
        stageZone - The stage zone in which Sprite will exist. Each stage zone is separated by a pit with total of 4 zones.
        xPos - x-Position of Sprite.
        yPos - y-Position of Sprite.
        xVel - x-Velocity of Sprite.
        yVel - y-Velocity of SPrite.
        sprites - Images containing Sprite States

    • Method Detail

      • checkPlayerCollided

        public boolean checkPlayerCollided()
        If Sprite collided with player (Mario). Checks by using fifth element (hit box) in SVGPath Array (logical count starting from one).
        Returns:
        True if player (Mario) collided with the Sprite, otherwise False.

      • topCollide

        public boolean topCollide()
        If the top of Sprite collided with any of StageBlocks (bricks, tiles etc). Checks by using very first element in SVGPath Array (logical count starting from one).
        Returns:
        True if top collided, else False.

      • rightCollide

        public boolean rightCollide(boolean checkElements)
        If the right of Sprite collided. Checks by using second element in SVGPath Array (logical count starting from one).
        Parameters:
        checkElements - Check StageBlock (tiles, bricks etc) for collision too along with stage floor.
        Returns:
        True if right collided, else False.

      • bottomCollide

        public boolean bottomCollide(boolean checkElements)
        If the bottom of Sprite collided. Checks by using third element in SVGPath Array (logical count starting from one).
        Parameters:
        checkElements - Check StageBlock (tiles, bricks etc) for collision too along with stage floor.
        Returns:
        True if bottom collided, else False.

      • leftCollide

        public boolean leftCollide(boolean checkElements)
        If the right of Sprite collided. Checks by using fourth element in SVGPath Array (logical count starting from one).
        Parameters:
        checkElements - Check StageBlock (tiles, bricks etc) for collision too along with stage floor.
        Returns:
        True if right collided, else False.

      • custCollide

        public boolean custCollide(int scale,
                           boolean checkElements)

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition()
        Updates position of Sprite on stage. Needs to be called manually in sprite logic (the update method).
        Overrides:
        updatePosition in class Sprite
